sorcery.question: Have I interacted with mediums, fortune tellers, tarot card readers, or Ouija boards through reading about them online, watching documentaries or shows featuring their practices, or engaging in conversations with others who participate in these activities?
sorcery.description: This sin is a violation of the First Commandment because it attempts to bypass God's providence and divine will by seeking supernatural knowledge through forbidden means, effectively placing trust in occult practices rather than in God.

extracted_data_phrases: either in your thoughts or when discussing the topic with others
apostasy.question: Have you explicitly rejected God's existence, either in your thoughts or when discussing the topic with others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: either internally to yourself or to others
apostasy.question: Have you, through your solo hobbies, reading materials, or online interactions, explicitly rejected the existence of God, either internally to yourself or to others?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.

extracted_data_phrases: through your internal reflections or explicit declarations to others
especially after having received the Sacrament of Baptism
apostasy.question: Have you, through your internal reflections or explicit declarations to others, denied the existence of God, especially after having received the Sacrament of Baptism?
apostasy.description: Denying God's existence after having been baptized apostasy is one of the gravest sins possible because it is declaring the Author of Life and Source of all being to be non-existent, which directly contradicts both reason and divine revelation.
